title: Norwegian appoints Silversea’s Odell for Australia role
text:
Norwegian appoints Silversea’s Odell for Australia role 1 July 2015 
Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings has appointed Silversea’s Steve Odell to head up its operations in the Australasia region. 

Odell, who had been Silversea’s president for UK, EMEA (Europe, Middle East and Africa) and Asia-Pacific, will be based in a new sales and marketing centre in Sydney and will have responsibility for all of Norwegian’s three lines including Oceania and Regent Seven Seas. 
NCLH said that Odell, who was with Silversea for 17 years, will take up the role of senior vice president and manager director Australasia from October 1. 
Harry Sommer, NCLH’s executive vice president of international business development, said: “In view of the growing international interest in cruising combined with our strong growth strategy, the new office in Australia is a natural next step in our global expansion. 
“It reflects our confidence in the growing Australia and New Zealand markets.” 
Silversea said in a statement that Odell “has decided to repatriate back to Australia and will pursue new activities there, after a 17-year successful career at Silversea”. 
“We wish Steve well in this new transition and thank him warmly for his contribution to Silversea’s success and growth in recent years,” added the cruise company.
